Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the amount of money saved by stating that ratepayers were saved $6 million per year.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that ratepayers were actually saved $6 million per year.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the savings will continue into the future, even though the circumstances have changed and the treatment plant is no longer necessary.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert questions whether it is accurate to claim the savings into the future, suggesting that there may be alternative explanations or factors to consider.
